what is a gene pool?: All genes present in a population, including all alleles for each gene.
what is allele frequency?: The number of times an allele occurs in a gene pool divided by the total number of alleles.

the genotype of an individual refers to:: The combination of alleles an individual carries.
the phenotype of an organism is:: The combination of its genotype and environmental influences.
evolutionary fitness is best defined as:: An individual's success in passing genes to the next generation.
an evolutionary adaptation is:: Any genetically controlled trait that increases an individual's fitness.
the genetic definition of a species is:: A population of interbreeding organisms that do not interbreed with other such groups.
genetically, a population is:: A group of individuals of the same species that mate and produce offspring.
behavioral isolation occurs when:: Populations evolve differences in courtship rituals or other behaviors that prevent interbreeding.
geographic isolation refers to:: Populations separated by barriers such as rivers or mountains.
temporal isolation occurs when:: Species reproduce at different times or seasons.
